subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|又|t1=hand|火|t2=fire|ls=ic}} – fire that can be touched with the hand (ash). {{zh-l|*又}} has been modified to {{zh-l|*𠂇}}; compare {{zh-l|*友|friend}}, {{zh-l|*右|right}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*pʷut ~ hwut||ashes, dust}} (STEDT; {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} reconstructs {{cog|sit-pro|*wu}}). Compare {{cog|lus|vutᴸ}}, {{cog|apt|mù-bu}}, {{cog|mni|ut}}, {{cog|tji|bu³ ci²}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:

|m=huī
|c=fui1
|h=pfs=fôi;gd=foi1
|md=ŭ

|mn_note=Xiamen, Quanzhou: he/her - vernacular; hoe - literary
|mn-t=huê1/hui1
|mn-t_note=hui1 - alternative pronunciation when meaning "grey" ({{zh-l|*灰色}})
|w=1hue
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n,a
}}
